page.title: 08RELIGION-LANGUAGE IN WALSALL
page.content: Changes have occured around{Chuckery {Junior School,Walsall}during the last 15 years. The terraced houses are frequently bought by{Asian families, most of whom are originally from {Pakistan.}The school population of{260 {children,}is now{37% Christian, 35% {Muslim, 9% Sikh}with a few{Hindus.}The school recently had a{Jewish}child. Some of the Christians are nominal. These denominations are represented: Baptist,Christadelphian,Church of England,Greek Orthodox,Jehovah Witness,Methodist,Pentecostal,Quaker, Roman Catholic,Spiritualist and United Reform. {English}is the mother tongue of{50%}of the children. Other first languages are{Punjabi 24%, Urdu 21%}with a few who speak Bengali, Gujerati, Greek, Italian and Cantonese.
